meanings.definition: In a manner that goes against the principles outlined in the constitution.
meanings.sent1: The law was unconstitutionally passed by the government.
meanings.sent2: The judge ruled that the action was unconstitutionally done.
meanings.sent3: The cat unconstitutionally decided to sleep on the dining table.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to wear pajamas to the formal event was unconstitutionally bold.
meanings.sent5: The storm unconstitutionally disrupted the peaceful town.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not in accordance with the constitution.
meanings.sent1: The new policy was unconstitutionally implemented by the school board.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's actions were unconstitutionally motivated.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unconstitutionally hoarded all the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent4: His speech was unconstitutionally powerful, stirring up emotions in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The virus unconstitutionally invaded the healthy cells in the body.
